latestAction.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 693.
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.title: Credit Union Examination Reform Act of 2016

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Credit Union Examination Reform Act of 2016

This bill amends the Federal Credit Union Act to permit an examination to be carried out only once every 18 months of a federal credit union or an insured credit union that:

  • has total assets of less than $1 billion;
  • is well capitalized (or adequately capitalized, in the case of an insured credit union);
  • was found in its most recent examination to be well managed, with a composite rating (under the Uniform Financial Institutions Rating System) of 1, in the case of a credit union that has total assets of more than $200 million, or 1 or 2, in the case of a credit union that has total assets of $200 million or less; and
  • is not currently subject to a formal enforcement proceeding or order by the National Credit Union Administration (NCUA).

Such limitation shall not apply if the NCUA determines that such a credit union: (1) should be examined more often because of safety and soundness concerns, or (2) has violated the law.

The NCUA shall issue a report on how this bill affects its budget.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GUINTA:H.R. 5419.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:To make all Laws which shall be necessary and proper forcarrying into Execution the foregoing Powers, and all otherPowers vested by this Constitution in the Government of theUnited States, or in any Department or Officer thereof.[Page H3663]

item.title: Credit Union Examination Reform Act of 2016
To amend the Federal Credit Union Act to extend the examination cycle of the National Credit Union Administration to 18 months for certain credit unions, and for other purposes.
Credit Union Examination Reform Act of 2016

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
